title: Augusta: D. C. Snyder to Rachel Snyder, January 21, 1865
summary: Snyder discusses the harsh weather and attempts to arrange a visit with his wife. He observes that civilians have become too selfish and have turned against the army. Snyder also laments the fact that he cannot be closer to his family.
keywords: Church/Religious Activity, Family, Home Front, Military Authority, Patriotism, Women, American Civil War
